summary: This bill, H.R. 3666, pertains to the relief of Luana S. Cordeiro. It grants her permanent resident status, waiving certain grounds for removal or denial of admission. It allows for adjustment of status if she enters the U.S. before a specified deadline. Procedures are outlined regarding applications, fees, and the reduction of available immigrant visas. The bill also addresses the budgetary effects of the act and denies preferential immigration treatment to her relatives. This bill grants a specific individual the right to permanent residence in the US.
